column4: how can i remove my already wireless card driver? i do not know which driver ubuntu is using now!!!
what will i type for seraching?
when i install my wireless driver via ndiswrapper, it says "impossible to detect if hardware is present". what can i do for this error?
it came with my laptop inside. i do not know!
try typing ifconfig -a in console and see if you find anything related to your wireless card
ok, but still i dont know which driver ubuntu is using!!! after ifconfig -a, it gave some results but nothing related!!!!
ogunac: some laptops have a power button for the wireless card, are you sure it has power?
yes it has and it is on
google your laptop and see if you can find any information about you wireless card and search for it in the synaptic manager or on your laptops support page
i found it now.. it is rt73
and in synaptic it seems uninstalled
but still i can connect to internet!!!!!!! how can it happen?
must be using a wireless driver.. but i can not see which!!! and acc to my laptop, my network driver is not installed via synaptic!!! should i install it?
but it is strange my friend!!!
would it not be more healthy if i installed the true driver?
you might be using the only true available driver
